snippet: An administrator described third-world conditions, with no hot water, no lab or radiology services and pails of water hauled up the stairs to use for flushing toilets.
abstract: Bellevue Hospital Center in Manhattan shuts down after fuel pumps for its backup generators fail; New York City's flagship public hospital and trauma center works through the night to evacuate the 300 remaining patients in its darkened building.

byline.original: By NINA BERNSTEIN and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

lead_paragraph: An administrator described third-world conditions, with no hot water, no lab or radiology services and pails of water hauled up the stairs to use for flushing toilets.

headline.seo: Bellevue Hospital Evacuates Patients After Backup Power Fails
